name: Search for the Titanic
summary:
Join the quest of the century in an authentic simulation that reflects man's achievement landing. The search for the Titanic, the greatest ship to ever fall to the grip of the elements, has peaked man's interest for decades. Experience the challenges and dangers, the excitement and reality of scientific under-water exploration as Search For The Titanic takes you on the quest to find the world's most famous lost ship. Reviewed for authenticity by the staff of the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, the American organization that first discovered and photographed the Titanic wreck, Search For The Titanic contains digitized pictures from the actual photos of the Titanic, taken at a depth of more than 12,000 feet. 
 
You begin as an inexperienced oceanographer. You must build your reputation, gaining points for finding and exploring other lost vessels, and earning the resources for a Titanic search. You plan each expedition — obtaining funding, a ship, personnel and the right equipment — then, chart the course and battle the elements as you dive for wrecks, gaining experience and expertise. Search For The Titanic includes over 75 wrecks to explore, more than 100 navigational maps and charts and 47 ports of call. Realistic weather patterns and currents, sophisticated sonar, magnetometers, under-water cameras and minisubs all come into play as you navigate the trade routes in search of missing ships. Search, locate and explore the Titanic and you will be rewarded with digitized pictures of the actual Titanic shipwreck as it sits on the ocean floor today.
